Uses of Interface
com.persistit.encoding.KeyCoder

Packages that use KeyCoder
com.persistit Implements Persistit™'s core functionality. 
com.persistit.encoding Implements extended encoding of objects and strings to and from Keys and Values. 
 

Uses of KeyCoder in com.persistit
 

Classes in com.persistit that implement KeyCoder
 class DefaultObjectCoder
           An ObjectCoder that uses reflection to access the properties and/or fields of an object.
 

Methods in com.persistit that return KeyCoder
 KeyCoder DefaultCoderManager.lookupKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz)
          Returns the KeyCoder registered for the supplied Class, or null if no KeyCoder is registered.
 KeyCoder DefaultCoderManager.registerKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz, KeyCoder coder)
          Associates a KeyCoder with a Class that it will encode.
 KeyCoder DefaultCoderManager.unregisterKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz)
          Removes any KeyCoder registered for the supplied Class
 

Methods in com.persistit that return types with arguments of type KeyCoder
 Map<Class<?>,KeyCoder> DefaultCoderManager.getRegisteredKeyCoders()
          Create a Map of Classes to registered KeyCoder s.
 

Methods in com.persistit with parameters of type KeyCoder
 KeyCoder DefaultCoderManager.registerKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz, KeyCoder coder)
          Associates a KeyCoder with a Class that it will encode.
 int DefaultCoderManager.unregisterKeyCoder(KeyCoder coder)
          Unregisters the supplied KeyCoder from all Classes it was previously registered to handle.
 

Uses of KeyCoder in com.persistit.encoding
 

Subinterfaces of KeyCoder in com.persistit.encoding
 interface KeyDisplayer
           An extension of KeyCoder that adds the KeyDisplayer.displayKeySegment(com.persistit.Key, java.lang.Appendable, java.lang.Class, com.persistit.encoding.CoderContext) method.
 interface KeyRenderer
           An extended KeyCoder that can populate a supplied Object with data that was formerly written to a Key by the KeyCoder .
 interface ObjectCoder
           Combines the KeyCoder, KeyRenderer, ValueCoder and ValueRenderer into a single interface that allows Persistit to store and retrieve arbitrary objects - even non-Serializable objects - without byte-code enhancement, without incurring the space or time overhead of Java serialization, or the need to modify the class to perform custom serialization.
 

Methods in com.persistit.encoding that return KeyCoder
 KeyCoder CoderManager.lookupKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz)
          Returns the KeyCoder registered for the supplied Class, or null if no KeyCoder is registered.
 KeyCoder CoderManager.registerKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz, KeyCoder coder)
          Register the provided KeyCoder to encode and decode instances of supplied class.
 KeyCoder CoderManager.unregisterKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz)
          Remove the registered KeyCoder for the supplied class.
 

Methods in com.persistit.encoding that return types with arguments of type KeyCoder
 Map<Class<?>,? extends KeyCoder> CoderManager.getRegisteredKeyCoders()
          Create a Map of Classes to registered KeyCoder s.
 

Methods in com.persistit.encoding with parameters of type KeyCoder
 KeyCoder CoderManager.registerKeyCoder(Class<?> clazz, KeyCoder coder)
          Register the provided KeyCoder to encode and decode instances of supplied class.
 int CoderManager.unregisterKeyCoder(KeyCoder coder)
          Remove the supplied KeyCoder from all classes to which it was previously registered.
